greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of exp(sqrt(2)/2).
comment: Define P(n) = (1/n)*Sum_{k=0..n-1} x(n-k)*P(k), n >= 1 and P(0) = 1 with x(2) = (sqrt(2) + 1) and x(n) = 1 for all other n.
We find that C2 = lim_{n->infinity} P(n) = exp(sqrt(2)/2).
The structure of the n!*P(n) formulas leads to the multinomial coefficients A036039.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
The Dev Team and Simon Plouffe, The Inverse Symbolic Calculator (ISC).
formula: c = lim_{n->infinity} P(n), with P(n) = (1/n)*Sum_{k=0..n-1} x(n-k)*P(k), for n >= 1, and P(0) = 1, with x(2) = (1 + sqrt(2)), the silver mean A014176, and x(n) = 1 for all other n.
maple: P := proc(n) : if n=0 then 1 else P(n) := expand((1/n)*(add(x(n-k)*P(k), k=0..n-1))) fi; end: x := proc(n): if n=2 then (sqrt(2)+1) else 1 fi: end:
mathematica: First@ RealDigits@ N[Exp[Sqrt[2]/2], 83] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jun 27 2016 *)
program: (PARI) my(x=exp(sqrt(2)/2)); for(k=1, 100, my(d=floor(x)); x=(x-d)*10; print1(d, ", ")) \\ _Felix Fröhlich_, Jun 27 2016
results.author: _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jun 27 2016
ext: More digits from _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Mar 15 2018
